a.g: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
For that is the one who drives away the orphan
And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
So woe to those who pray
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Status and Ostentation
Know that hypocrisy (Riya') is forbidden and the hypocrite (Mura'i) is detested by Allah, and the verses, reports, and traditions testify to that. As for the verses: then His saying, the Exalted, "So woe to those who pray, who are heedless of their prayer, who make show (of their deeds)" and His saying, the Mighty and Majestic, "And those who plot evil deeds, for them is a severe punishment, and the plotting of those, it will perish" said Mujahid: they are the people of hypocrisy (Riya'). And He said, the Exalted, "We feed you only for the Face (Wajh) of Allah. We wish no reward nor thanks from you" so He praised the sincere ones (Mukhlisin) by negating every intention (Iradah) except the Face (Wajh) of Allah, and hypocrisy (Riya') is its opposite. And He said, the Exalted, "So whoever hopes for the meeting with his Lord, let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone" it was revealed after that concerning those who seek reward and praise with their acts of worship and deeds.

a.g: [But] who are heedless of their prayer -
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Secrets of Prayer
And Abu Al-'Aliyah was asked about the saying of Allah the Exalted: 'Those who are heedless (Sahoon) of their prayer' (Quran 107:5). He said: 'It is the one who is heedless (Yas-haw) in his prayer, so he does not know upon how many he concludes - upon an even (Shaf') or upon an odd (Watr).' And Al-Hasan said: 'It is the one who is heedless (Yas-haw) of the time of prayer until it passes.' And some of them said: 'It is the one who, if he prays it at the beginning of its time, does not rejoice, and if he delays it beyond its time, does not grieve, so he does not see hastening it as good nor delaying it as sin.'
